meanings.definition: To change the position or order of something.
meanings.sent1: I will transpose the books on the shelf to make them look neater.
meanings.sent2: Can you transpose the numbers in the list to put them in ascending order?
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to transpose the rabbit with the hat, but it ended up in his pocket instead.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions seemed to transpose from joy to sadness in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes were able to transpose a sense of movement onto the canvas.

meanings.definition: To transfer or move something to a different place or context.
meanings.sent1: We need to transpose the data from the old system to the new one.
meanings.sent2: She had to transpose her ideas from the presentation to the report format.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to transpose the ingredients from the dessert to the main course.
meanings.sent4: His dreams seemed to transpose reality with fantasy in a mesmerizing way.
meanings.sent5: The melody was able to transpose the listener to a different time and place.
